page.title: 03THE NORMANS AND BEYOND
page.content: The Castle Eden Dene area because it was so far away from any major centre of government was very independent.When Robert Comyn was killed by the Saxons of Durham,William I came north and slaughtered everything in sight.Then the Scots invaded and finished the job.When the original Domesday Survey was then made in 1086 the area was not included.It was surveyed in the Boldon Book in 1183 for Bishop Pudsey.By 1380 and the Hatfield Survey the area was vey poor.In 1432 the men of Castle Eden and friends went wrecking at Blackhall to supplement their incomes.Prosperity did not improve until in 1758 Rowland Burdon Snr. a merchant banker began investing in Castle Eden,and other local property.He rebuilt the Norman castle and church and his work was carried on by his son.
